meanings.definition: A device controlling the flow of fuel or power to an engine.
meanings.sent1: The throttle on the lawnmower helps regulate how much fuel goes to the engine.
meanings.sent2: The pilot adjusted the throttle to increase the speed of the airplane.
meanings.sent3: When the throttle on the boat got stuck, it made for a bumpy ride.
meanings.sent4: His creativity was like a well-tuned throttle, smoothly delivering ideas to his mind.
meanings.sent5: The throttle, like a gatekeeper, determined how much power the engine could receive.

meanings.sent1: He tried to throttle his laughter during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent2: The python can throttle its prey with incredible strength.
meanings.sent3: She felt like the tight collar was trying to throttle her.
meanings.sent4: The vines seemed to throttle the life out of the old tree.
meanings.sent5: The boxer managed to throttle his opponent in the final round.

meanings.sent1: The dictator tried to throttle any opposition to his rule.
meanings.sent2: Fear can sometimes throttle our ability to take risks.
meanings.sent3: The heavy workload seemed to throttle their creativity.
meanings.sent4: Her anxiety seemed to throttle her confidence before the presentation.
meanings.sent5: The strict rules seemed to throttle the students' freedom to express themselves.
